result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan J Quinn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

(9:24 AM case called.) Defendant Logan J Quinn does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Logan J Quinn. Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend Count 1 to an ordinance violation of County Disorderly Conduct without the domestic enhancer.
Court orders Count 1 is amended to an ordinance violation of County Disorderly Conduct.
Attorney Amundson enters a No Contest plea on the defendant's behalf to Amended Count 1: County Disorderly Conduct.
Court accepts the No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of Amended Count 1.
Court orders the trial is removed from the calendar.
Attorney Amundson updates the defendant's address with the Court.

Court orders sentence for the defendant to pay court costs.
Jury trial on November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Parties are requesting 1 day trial and Court advises will schedule for 2 days.
Defendant must have finger prints taken between the dates of August 9-11, 2022.
Final Status Conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 9:30 am (1/2 hour) in person.
Jury Trial scheduled for November 15 and 16, 2022 with the final pre-trial to begin at 8:30 am and jury selection to begin at 9 am.
